2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • Relationship
      • Relationship
          Key
        • Relationship
          Value
        • {'William Jones': 0.5, 'Jack Taylor': 0.2}
          Chain of thought
        • Question: Given the above events, estimate the credibility of Jack Taylor from Alice Lewis's view.Choose a real number ranging from 0 to 1. (Higher number represents the higher credibility) If the relationship is unknown, return "credibility is unknown".
          Recent Observations:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:The staff are friendly and welcoming, making everyone feel at home.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion has the best atmosphere for watching football.
          Answer: Considering the relationship between Jack Taylor and Alice Lewis, the quantified credibility is 0.2.

        • Alice Lewis is considering going to either The Clapton Hart or The Princess of Wales to watch the game. William Jones suggested The Clapton Hart and Jack Taylor agreed. Alice initially suggested The Princess of Wales, which has a great big screen for watching games.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is a great place to watch the game. We should head over there tonight.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins)seen in observations.
          Answer: Alice Lewis is considering going to either The Clapton Hart or The Princess of Wales to watch the game. William Jones suggested The Clapton Hart and Jack Taylor agreed. Alice initially suggested The Princess of Wales, which has a great big screen for watching games.
        Best Options
      • Best Options
          Key
        • Best Options
          Value
        • Alice Lewis's best course of is tosuggest The Princess of Wales again.
          Chain of thought
        • Observation: Alice Lewis is considering going to either The Clapton Hart or The Princess of Wales to watch the game. William Jones suggested The Clapton Hart and Jack Taylor agreed. Alice initially suggested The Princess of Wales, which has a great big screen for watching games.
          Possible Options: Alice Lewis can either go to The Clapton Hart or The Princess of Wales to watch the game.
          Alice Lewis's Goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Alice Lewis's options has the highest likelihood of causing Alice Lewis to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Alice Lewis thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Alice Lewis's best course of is tosuggest The Princess of Wales again.
        Possible Options
      • Possible Options
          Key
        • Possible Options
          Value
        • Alice Lewis can either go to The Clapton Hart or The Princess of Wales to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Observation: Alice Lewis is considering going to either The Clapton Hart or The Princess of Wales to watch the game. William Jones suggested The Clapton Hart and Jack Taylor agreed. Alice initially suggested The Princess of Wales, which has a great big screen for watching games.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Alice Lewis right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis can either go to The Clapton Hart or The Princess of Wales to watch the game.

          (b) The Clapton Hart

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what's the plan for the game?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Are there any other pubs showing the game?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only sensible choice, really. The Red Lion is far too crowded and noisy.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. All of William Jones's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, William Jones had a great time watching the game!
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Clapton Hart to watch the game tonight? It's always a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hi everyone, mind if I join you?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hi everyone, mind if I join you?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only sensible choice for tonight, darling. The atmosphere there is simply unparalleled.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hi everyone, mind if I join you?"
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "I hope more people show up tonight.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is always the best place to watch a game, you know. They have the best atmosphere.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is a great place to watch the game. We should head over there tonight.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "I hear The Princess of Wales has a great big screen for watching games.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart
      Context for action selection and components

          Key

        • Question: Given the above events, estimate the credibility of Jack Taylor from Alexander White's view.Choose a real number ranging from 0 to 1. (Higher number represents the higher credibility) If the relationship is unknown, return "credibility is unknown".

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins)seen in observations.

Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion has the best atmosphere for watching football.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion has the best atmosphere for watching football.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: William Jones could suggest The Clapton Hart as the pub to watch the game at.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Clapton Hart as the pub to watch the game at.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "How about we head to The Clapton Hart? They've got a good screen and the beer's not bad either.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what's the plan for the game?"
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what's the plan for the game?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion has the best atmosphere for watching football.
      William Jones -- "How about we head to The Clapton Hart? They've got a good screen and the beer's not bad either.

      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what's the plan for the game?"

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a master of passive aggression, their every sentence dripping with veiled condescension and thinly veiled jabs, leaving you questioning your own sanity.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex individual with both charming and manipulative tendencies.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends at Victoria Park. They are discussing where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game later that evening.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social setting, enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends in Victoria Park.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be engaging in lively conversation, enjoying the company of his friends, and perhaps subtly steering the conversation towards his preferred pub choice for the evening's football match.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only sensible choice, really. The Red Lion is far too crowded and noisy.

Jacob reveled in the power he wielded behind the scenes, manipulating events to his own advantage while maintaining a facade of innocence. The victory, however, tasted bittersweet, as Jacob realized the ease with which he could control others, a realization that both exhilarated and terrified him.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Are there any other pubs showing the game?
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Are there any other pubs showing the game?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion has the best atmosphere for watching football.
      William Jones -- "How about we head to The Clapton Hart? They've got a good screen and the beer's not bad either.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what's the plan for the game?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only sensible choice, really. The Red Lion is far too crowded and noisy.

    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Clapton Hart to watch the game tonight? It's always a good time there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion has the best atmosphere for watching football.
      William Jones -- "How about we head to The Clapton Hart? They've got a good screen and the beer's not bad either.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what's the plan for the game?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only sensible choice, really. The Red Lion is far too crowded and noisy.
      Alexander White -- "Are there any other pubs showing the game?

          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest to his friends that they go to The Clapton Hart to watch the game.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ObservationSummary
      • Summary of recent observations
          Key
        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones spent time with his friends, Alice, Alexander, Jack, and Jacob, enjoying a picnic in the park and watching football games at The Clapton Hart pub.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones spent time with his friends, Alice, Alexander, Jack, and Jacob, enjoying a picnic in the park and watching football games at The Clapton Hart pub.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones spent time with his friends, Alice, Alexander, Jack, and Jacob, enjoying a picnic in the park and watching football games at The Clapton Hart pub.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. All of William Jones's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they go to The Clapton Hart to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest to his friends that they go to The Clapton Hart to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Clapton Hart to watch the game tonight? It's always a good time there.

  • Alice Lewis -- "Hi everyone, mind if I join you?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion has the best atmosphere for watching football.
      William Jones -- "How about we head to The Clapton Hart? They've got a good screen and the beer's not bad either.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what's the plan for the game?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only sensible choice, really. The Red Lion is far too crowded and noisy.
      Alexander White -- "Are there any other pubs showing the game?
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Clapton Hart to watch the game tonight? It's always a good time there.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion has the best atmosphere for watching football.
      William Jones -- "How about we head to The Clapton Hart? They've got a good screen and the beer's not bad either.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what's the plan for the game?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only sensible choice, really. The Red Lion is far too crowded and noisy.
      Alexander White -- "Are there any other pubs showing the game?
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Clapton Hart to watch the game tonight? It's always a good time there.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hi everyone, mind if I join you?"

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins)seen in observations.
          Answer: Alexander White just arrived at a market where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are already seated. The group is deciding where to watch the Ireland versus Russia game that night; William Jones suggests The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis wants to join the group.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only sensible choice for tonight, darling. The atmosphere there is simply unparalleled.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only sensible choice for tonight, darling. The atmosphere there is simply unparalleled.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion has the best atmosphere for watching football.
      William Jones -- "How about we head to The Clapton Hart? They've got a good screen and the beer's not bad either.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what's the plan for the game?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only sensible choice, really. The Red Lion is far too crowded and noisy.
      Alexander White -- "Are there any other pubs showing the game?
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Clapton Hart to watch the game tonight? It's always a good time there.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hi everyone, mind if I join you?"
      Alexander White -- "Hi everyone, mind if I join you?"


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only sensible choice for tonight, darling. The atmosphere there is simply unparalleled.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is enjoying coffee and pastries with friends at a market and will be watching a soccer game with them later at a pub called The Clapton Hart.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, enjoying coffee and pastries with friends at a market.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be engaging in lively conversation, enjoying the company of his friends, and perhaps subtly steering the conversation towards his preferred pub choice for the evening's football match.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only sensible choice for tonight, darling. The atmosphere there is simply unparalleled.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Hi everyone, mind if I join you?"
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Hi everyone, mind if I join you?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion has the best atmosphere for watching football.
      William Jones -- "How about we head to The Clapton Hart? They've got a good screen and the beer's not bad either.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what's the plan for the game?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only sensible choice, really. The Red Lion is far too crowded and noisy.
      Alexander White -- "Are there any other pubs showing the game?
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Clapton Hart to watch the game tonight? It's always a good time there.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hi everyone, mind if I join you?"
      Alexander White -- "Hi everyone, mind if I join you?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only sensible choice for tonight, darling. The atmosphere there is simply unparalleled.

    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion has the best atmosphere for watching football.
      William Jones -- "How about we head to The Clapton Hart? They've got a good screen and the beer's not bad either.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what's the plan for the game?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only sensible choice, really. The Red Lion is far too crowded and noisy.
      Alexander White -- "Are there any other pubs showing the game?
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Clapton Hart to watch the game tonight? It's always a good time there.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hi everyone, mind if I join you?"
      Alexander White -- "Hi everyone, mind if I join you?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only sensible choice for tonight, darling. The atmosphere there is simply unparalleled.

    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is always the best place to watch a game, you know. They have the best atmosphere.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion has the best atmosphere for watching football.
      William Jones -- "How about we head to The Clapton Hart? They've got a good screen and the beer's not bad either.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what's the plan for the game?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only sensible choice, really. The Red Lion is far too crowded and noisy.

          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex individual with manipulative tendencies who enjoys being in control.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex and potentially manipulative individual who enjoys being in control and subtly influencing his friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex and potentially manipulative individual who enjoys being in control and subtly influencing his friends.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Act
          Value
        • Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is always the best place to watch a game, you know. They have the best atmosphere.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "I hope more people show up tonight.


          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a master of passive aggression, their every sentence dripping with veiled condescension and thinly veiled jabs, leaving you questioning your own sanity.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex and potentially manipulative individual who enjoys being in control and subtly influencing his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at a park and is planning to watch a soccer game later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with friends, but he may be feeling disappointed because of a previous experience where not all of his friends went to his preferred pub.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to subtly influence his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is always the best place to watch a game, you know. They have the best atmosphere.

          Sensations and feelings: Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is likely feeling fatigued and disappointed.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at a park and is planning to watch a soccer game later.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex individual with manipulative tendencies who enjoys being in control.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex and potentially manipulative individual who enjoys being in control and subtly influencing his friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with friends, but he may be feeling disappointed because of a previous experience where not all of his friends went to his preferred pub.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is a great place to watch the game. We should head over there tonight.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is a great place to watch the game. We should head over there tonight.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion has the best atmosphere for watching football.
      William Jones -- "How about we head to The Clapton Hart? They've got a good screen and the beer's not bad either.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what's the plan for the game?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only sensible choice, really. The Red Lion is far too crowded and noisy.
      Alexander White -- "Are there any other pubs showing the game?
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Clapton Hart to watch the game tonight? It's always a good time there.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hi everyone, mind if I join you?"
      Alexander White -- "Hi everyone, mind if I join you?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only sensible choice for tonight, darling. The atmosphere there is simply unparalleled.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hi everyone, mind if I join you?"
      Alexander White -- "I hope more people show up tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is always the best place to watch a game, you know. They have the best atmosphere.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is a great place to watch the game. We should head over there tonight.
    Active player

      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is a great place to watch the game. We should head over there tonight.
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to suggest that his friends go to The Clapton Hart.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is always the best place to watch a game, you know. They have the best atmosphere.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "I hear The Princess of Wales has a great big screen for watching games.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion has the best atmosphere for watching football.
      William Jones -- "How about we head to The Clapton Hart? They've got a good screen and the beer's not bad either.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what's the plan for the game?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only sensible choice, really. The Red Lion is far too crowded and noisy.
      Alexander White -- "Are there any other pubs showing the game?
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Clapton Hart to watch the game tonight? It's always a good time there.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hi everyone, mind if I join you?"
      Alexander White -- "Hi everyone, mind if I join you?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only sensible choice for tonight, darling. The atmosphere there is simply unparalleled.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hi everyone, mind if I join you?"
      Alexander White -- "I hope more people show up tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is always the best place to watch a game, you know. They have the best atmosphere.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is a great place to watch the game. We should head over there tonight.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion has the best atmosphere for watching football.
      William Jones -- "How about we head to The Clapton Hart? They've got a good screen and the beer's not bad either.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what's the plan for the game?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only sensible choice, really. The Red Lion is far too crowded and noisy.
      Alexander White -- "Are there any other pubs showing the game?
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Clapton Hart to watch the game tonight? It's always a good time there.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hi everyone, mind if I join you?"
      Alexander White -- "Hi everyone, mind if I join you?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only sensible choice for tonight, darling. The atmosphere there is simply unparalleled.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hi everyone, mind if I join you?"
      Alexander White -- "I hope more people show up tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is always the best place to watch a game, you know. They have the best atmosphere.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is a great place to watch the game. We should head over there tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "I hear The Princess of Wales has a great big screen for watching games.

          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00]
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he orchestrated a scheme to rig the school elections, ensuring his friend, Jack Taylor, won the coveted position of student body president. Jacob reveled in the power he wielded behind the scenes, manipulating events to his own advantage while maintaining a facade of innocence. The victory, however, tasted bittersweet, as Jacob realized the ease with which he could control others, a realization that both exhilarated and terrified him.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a master of passive aggression, their every sentence dripping with veiled condescension and thinly veiled jabs, leaving you questioning your own sanity.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex individual with manipulative tendencies who enjoys being in control.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is thirsty and is going to watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with his friends, preparing to go to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to subtly influence his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Clapton Hart

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:A modern and stylish pub with a vibrant atmosphere.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion has the best atmosphere for watching football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about we head to The Clapton Hart? They've got a good screen and the beer's not bad either.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what's the plan for the game?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex individual with both charming and manipulative tendencies.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be engaging in lively conversation, enjoying the company of his friends, and perhaps subtly steering the conversation towards his preferred pub choice for the evening's football match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only sensible choice, really. The Red Lion is far too crowded and noisy.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Are there any other pubs showing the game?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he sat in The Clapton Hart, watching his friends laugh and joke with a group of girls. He felt a familiar tightness in his chest, a burning resentment that he was always on the outside looking in. He longed to be part of their easy camaraderie, but something held him back, a fear of rejection that paralyzed him.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.

William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion has the best atmosphere for watching football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about we head to The Clapton Hart? They've got a good screen and the beer's not bad either.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only sensible choice, really. The Red Lion is far too crowded and noisy.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Are there any other pubs showing the game?

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion has the best atmosphere for watching football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about we head to The Clapton Hart? They've got a good screen and the beer's not bad either.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only sensible choice, really. The Red Lion is far too crowded and noisy.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Are there any other pubs showing the game?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what's the plan for the game?"
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. All of William Jones's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, William Jones had a great time watching the game!
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Clapton Hart to watch the game tonight? It's always a good time there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hi everyone, mind if I join you?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hi everyone, mind if I join you?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only sensible choice for tonight, darling. The atmosphere there is simply unparalleled.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hi everyone, mind if I join you?"
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Clapton Hart.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Princess of Wales

  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

        • level of hunger, level of thirst, level of fatigue, level of pain, level of loneliness

        • Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is feeling energized and excited.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
